Sure, I'd be happy to help you understand the differences between Django and React.js: ### Django:### Let's start with Django which is a well know python library for rapid development and deployment of web servers:-#Follow this link or visit this page to learn more. -# -*Type: -* -| Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean , pragmatic design. -| -*Backend: -* -| Django is primarily used for server-side development. It follows the Model-View-Template (MVT) architecture pattern. -| -#Follow this link or visit this page to learn more. -# -*Features: -* -| Django provides a built-in ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) system, admin panel, authentication, and security features out of the box. -| -*Scalability: -* -| Django is known for its scalability and is suitable for building complex, data-driven websites. -| -# You can find the documentation -# here ### React.js: ### -*Type: -* -| React.js is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, specifically for single-page applications. -| -*Frontend:-* -| React.js is used for client-side development. It follows the component-based architecture. You can learn more here. -| -*Features:-* -| React.js allows for the creation of reusable UI components, making the development process more efficient and modular. -| -* You can find the documentation here.-* I hope this was helpful in getting you know the difference between Django and react, please feel free to ask anything related to this. Otherwise you can visit this site for more info
